comment: Professor Russell was my public speaking professor and he was the best professor I've had so far. He made public speaking seem easy and not a worrisome subject. He helped me become more confident when it came to my conversational skills as well as public speaking skills.

Professor Russell was outstanding. He was more than willing to assist and provide feedback on our speeches. He helps his students become better speakers and people in general. He takes time to make sure we grow instead of just grading and moving on. He was available all the time. Great professor, great teaching, and brings awesome, new insight.

Dr. Russell is a super nice guy, very personable and obviously passionate about what he does. He works with you and your writing partner in order to make sure your final paper is as good as possible- 5 very easy quizzes based on the weekly readings (provided, no textbook) with the lowest score dropped. Best professor I've had at KSU so far.

Professor Russell is easily the most solid professor I've taken. He's very understanding, helpful, and friendly. He answers emails very quickly, and you only really have to come to class to give presentations, with the exception of two in-class activities. He grades very generously, and you can turn in work late for full credit.

Extremely easy online class. Online reading and quizzes and Revel which were super easy to get 100's on. 13 optional unit written work options but only the top 5 scores are put in the gradebook. And then a midterm and a final on Lockdown Browser but no webcam. Well organized course and super easy to make an A.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: I was so scared to take public speaking but John Russell has made this class ten times easier than I thought it would be. He is so nice and he gives very helpful feedback. He's so cool, take him if you can.

Extremely easy class half of the work is optional and whatever else you do just counts as extra credit towards your final grade. You may need the textbook for some mini assignments and a quiz here or there but overall I mostly just glanced at it every now and then.

John is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is really understanding about any questions or obstacles that you may have. His work is laid back and he gives you plenty of time to get it done. His activities are creative and engaging so you feel like you actually learn stuff. He grades clearly will work with you to get the grade you want.
John Russell was the best teacher I had this past semester. He will always correct you on mistakes and is very supportive. Mr. Russell is literally a must take.

all I do is click through the textbook and quizzes for an hour on Sundays and got a solid A. would 100% recommend. he is nice, funny, wants you to do well, and has a clear syllabus and options to do every week. if you're choosing between profs, PICK THIS ONE. he is amazing.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! John was literally my favorite professor last semester and I made sure to use him as an instructor for a different class next semester. He makes public speaking something to not be afraid of. He lets you have freedom in picking topics within reason and will help you improve on each speech. Our class was so close, I miss it!

He is such an amazing professor, and I would say the best there is at KSU. I was so nervous going into Public Speaking, but he helps you along the way and does what he can to make you a better speaker. It is not a test-heavy class, but you have about 5 speeches and a few assignments. If this is a required course for you I highly recommend John.

I loved John! Such a cool guy, super chill and understanding (especially among COVID19). He knows his stuff and he approaches the class in such a way that you feel supported; he helps build your confidence as the class progresses and you will become a better speaker at the end of it. Ill miss him and wish the in-class experience wasnt cut short!

He likes to go by John instead of professor. He is a very nice guy and he makes his class engaged during his lectures even tho there are 90 students. He does take attendance and there are 4 tests and weekly assignments. My class was his first class he had at KSU and it went pretty smoothly. He is more about teaching than just giving grades. 10/10.
Prof. Russell was a solid choice for Communications 1100. Attendance is not mandatory, but does help your understanding of the topics. Tests are very easy if you study. Overall solid professor!

John is one of (if not the) best Professor Ive ever taken. I was honestly scared going into the class, but he understands that and works with you. He doesnt like lectures much, so theyre very short. He tries to pick topics interesting to us. John is just a great Professor and great guy. Sad his class is over. Take him, you wont regret it

He's a great professor! Public speaking is such a nerve wracking thing to do and it definitely helps when your professor is as caring and understanding as John! I loved having him as a professor and if I could take him again I would! He is probably my favorite professor that I have had at KSU! So, for your public speaking class he's the way to go!

I was scared for public speaking going into it, but John made it one of my favorite classes. The class itself is fun since (he told us to call him John on day one if that tells you anything about him). He genuinely wants you to do well and understands how scary public speaking may be. This will be one class I'll seriously miss. TAKE HIM!!!
